text: Jacqueline Andrée Naze Tjøtta (1 June 1935 - 9 March 2017) was a French-born Norwegian mathematician. She became the first female mathematical sciences professor in Norway. Naze was born in Montpellier, France. She graduated in mathematics from the Aix-Marseille University and Sorbonne, Paris. She married Norwegian mathematician Sigve Tjøtta in 1964. Naze was appointed professor in applied mathematics at the University of Bergen from 1966. Her research interests have focused on kinetic theory, magnetohydrodynamics and theoretical acoustics. Naze died in Oslo, Norway on 9 March 2017, aged 81. ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2017 deaths Category:French mathematicians Category:Norwegian scientists Category:Academics of the University of Bergen Category:People from Montpellier
title: Jacqueline Naze Tjøtta
